comments.text:
Last Value ($) Tests
Tests for the last value functionality where literals and commands update $
Test 1: String literal sets last value

args.value: Test 1: String literal sets last value
String literal should set $ to the string value

comments.text: Test 2: Number literal sets last value

args.value: Test 2: Number literal sets last value
Number literal should set $ to the number value

comments.text: Test 3: Boolean literal sets last value

args.value: Test 3: Boolean literal sets last value
Boolean true should set $ to true
Boolean false should set $ to false

comments.text: Test 4: Null literal sets last value

args.value: Test 4: Null literal sets last value
Null literal should set $ to null

comments.text: Test 5: Array literal sets last value

args.value: Test 5: Array literal sets last value
Array literal should set $ to the array value

comments.text: Test 6: Object literal sets last value

args.value: Test 6: Object literal sets last value
Object literal should set $ to the object value

comments.text: Test 7: Multiple literals in sequence
Test 8: say command returns value and sets last value

args.value: Test 8: say command returns value and sets last value
say command should set $ to the concatenated output
say with multiple args should set $ to concatenated string

comments.text: Test 9: Commands that return values update last value

args.value: Test 9: Commands that return values update last value
math.add should set $ to the result
string.concat should set $ to the result

comments.text: Test 10: Using last value in expressions

args.value: Test 10: Using last value in expressions

comments.text: Test 11: Last value with into assignment

args.value: Test 11: Last value with into assignment
into assignment should work with last value

comments.text: Test 12: Last value in subexpressions

args.value: Last value in subexpression should work

comments.text: Test 13: Last value in template strings

args.value: Test 13: Last value in template strings
Last value in template string should work

comments.text: Test 14: Last value with function calls

args.value: Test 14: Last value with function calls

comments.text: Test 15: Last value with object/array operations

args.value: Test 15: Last value with object/array operations
get should set $ to the property value
array.length should set $ to the length

comments.text: Test 16: Last value chain
Test 17: Last value with conditional

args.value: Last value in conditional should work

comments.text: Test 18: Last value with loops

args.value: Last value in loop should accumulate (0+1+2+3+4 = 10)

comments.text: Test 19: Last value with do blocks

args.value: Test 19: Last value with do blocks
Last value in do block should work

comments.text: Test 20: Last value preservation with assignments

args.value: Test 20: Last value preservation with assignments
Assignment should not change $ (into preserves it)

comments.text: Test 21: Empty last value
Test 22: Last value with nested operations

args.value: Test 22: Last value with nested operations

comments.text: Test 23: Last value with say and log

args.value: Test 23: Last value with say and log

comments.text: Should log "test"

args.value: say should set $ and log should not change it

comments.text: Test 24: Last value with template string evaluation

args.value: Test 24: Last value with template string evaluation

comments.text: Test 25: Last value with complex object

args.value: Test 25: Last value with complex object
Nested object access with $ should work

comments.text: Test 26: Basic subexpression sets last value

args.value: Test 26: Basic subexpression sets last value
Subexpression should set $ to its result

comments.text: Test 27: Subexpression with string operations
Test 28: Subexpression with multiple statements

args.value: Subexpression with multiple statements should set $ to last result (10+5=15, 15*2=30)

comments.text: Test 29: Nested subexpression (2 levels)
Test 30: Deeply nested subexpression (3 levels)
Test 31: Nested subexpression with last value from outer scope

args.value: Test 31: Nested subexpression with last value from outer scope
Nested subexpression using outer $ should work (10+5=15, 15*2=30)

comments.text: Test 32: Subexpression chain
Test 33: Subexpression returning string

args.value: Subexpression should return and set string value

comments.text: Test 34: Subexpression returning array

args.value: Subexpression should return and set array value

comments.text: Test 35: Subexpression returning object

args.value: Subexpression should return and set object value

comments.text: Test 36: Nested subexpression with different operations

args.value: Test 36: Nested subexpression with different operations
Nested subexpression with math and string should work

comments.text: Test 37: Multiple nested subexpressions at same level

args.value: Test 37: Multiple nested subexpressions at same level

comments.text: Test 38: Subexpression with conditional inside

args.value: Subexpression with conditional should set $ to result

comments.text: Test 39: Nested subexpression preserving outer last value

args.value: Test 39: Nested subexpression preserving outer last value
Subexpression should update $ even after outer value

comments.text: Test 40: Deeply nested subexpression (4 levels)
Test 41: Subexpression with function call

args.value: Subexpression with function call should set $ to return value

comments.text: Test 42: Nested subexpression with function calls

args.value: Test 42: Nested subexpression with function calls
Nested subexpression with function calls should work (5*2=10, 3*2=6, 10+6=16)

comments.text: Test 43: Subexpression with array operations
Test 44: Nested subexpression with object access

args.value: Test 44: Nested subexpression with object access
Nested subexpression with object access should work

comments.text: Test 45: Subexpression with last value in nested context

args.value: Test 45: Subexpression with last value in nested context
Nested subexpression using outer $ should work (5+3=8, 8*2=16)
